entry.title: Combined summary - bitcoin-dev Mailing List Migration (Action Required)
entry.summary:
The migration of the bitcoindev mailing list to Google Groups marks a significant update for its members. As of February 2024, new subscriptions to the old list will no longer be accepted, urging stakeholders to subscribe to the new venue without delay. A temporary pause in email traffic will ensure subscribers have ample time to join before the exchange resumes. Subscription can be accomplished through two primary methods: directly via email or by utilizing the Google Groups online interface, which accepts any email address associated with a Google account. This transition aims to promote active participation within the community by encouraging members to opt-in for receiving all messages, thus facilitating easier responses and engagement in ongoing discussions.
For organizational purposes, members are advised to filter incoming emails from the mailing list, ensuring their main inbox remains uncluttered. The archive of past communications has been made accessible, both through an online interface that doesn't require a Google account and via an external backup at gnusha.org, which also hosts content from the old mailing list. Although Google's infrastructure is utilized for this initiative, the critical nature of the information shared remains public, emphasizing the non-essential role of Google in the dissemination process. To foster a decentralized approach, the community is encouraged to establish additional public archives of the mailing list, with clear instructions provided for those interested in setting up such resources. An extensive archive, including a comprehensive collection of the bitcoin-dev mailing list, is available for download, featuring verification hashes to confirm data integrity.
It's crucial for participants to remember the core function of mailing lists as a broad communication platform, bearing in mind the importance of maintaining topic relevance to ensure a beneficial signal-to-noise ratio for all members. The guidelines governing the mailing list's use remain unchanged, supporting a consistent framework for interaction and moderation. Special thanks were extended to Joe Rayhawk for his instrumental support during the migration process, alongside contact details for moderators, offering a direct channel for assistance or further discussion related to the mailing list's operation.
